questions.correctAnswer: A physical quantity that varies with time or space
questions.explanation: A signal is defined as a physical quantity (like voltage, temperature, or pressure) that varies with one or more independent variables, typically time. Devices that process information are called systems. Electrical components are hardware elements. Mathematical operators describe transformations, not signals themselves.

questions.prompt: Which of the following is a SYSTEM?
questions.explanation: An amplifier is a system because it transforms an input signal (low amplitude) into an output signal (high amplitude). ECG waveforms, temperature readings, and stock prices are all signalsâ€”they represent varying quantities, not devices that transform signals.

Parentheses x(t) indicate a continuous-time signal, defined for all real values of t. Brackets x[n] would indicate discrete-time. The notation convention is universal in signals and systems: () for continuous, [] for discrete.

questions.prompt: A microphone is best described as:
questions.explanation: A microphone is a transducerâ€”a type of system that converts one form of signal (acoustic pressure waves) to another form (electrical voltage). It's not the signal itself, not an amplifier (which increases magnitude), and not a filter (which removes frequencies).

questions.prompt: In the notation y(t) = T{x(t)}, what does T represent?
questions.explanation: T (or ð’¯) represents the system operator that transforms the input signal x(t) into the output signal y(t). Time is the independent variable t, not T. Temperature is unrelated. Transfer function H(s) is a Laplace domain representation, different from the general operator notation.

questions.prompt: Which is an example of a 2D signal?
questions.explanation: A grayscale image I(x,y) is a 2D signal with two independent spatial variables (x and y position). Audio waveforms, temperature over time, and stock prices are all 1D signals indexed only by time.

questions.prompt: What type of connection feeds the output back to the input?
questions.explanation: In a feedback connection, the output signal is fed back and combined with the input. This is the basis of control systems. Cascade (series) connection chains systems sequentially. Parallel sends the same input to multiple systems. Series is another name for cascade.

questions.prompt: Why are electrical signals preferred for processing?
options: They are the only type that exists
They are easy to amplify, filter, and transmit
questions.correctAnswer: They are easy to amplify, filter, and transmit
questions.explanation: Electrical signals are preferred because they are easy to process (amplify, filter), transmit (wires, wireless), and store (digital memory). Many other signal types exist. Transducers are needed to convert other signals to electrical. Electrical signals can be analog or digital.

questions.prompt: In a block diagram, what do arrows represent?
questions.explanation: In block diagrams, arrows represent the flow of signals from one system (block) to another. Power flow is a different engineering concept. System boundaries are the blocks themselves. Time direction is implicit, not shown by arrows.

A speaker is a transducer that converts electrical signals (voltage variations) into acoustic signals (sound pressure variations). A microphone does the opposite (acoustic to electrical). DACs convert digital to analog. Photodiodes convert light to electrical.
